results.title: Age of metals: can it last?
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Christopher McCullough and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
Episode 7 from the interesting series “Out of the fiery furnace” discusses whether societies accept the environmental penalties of increased metal mining? Are there enough metals left on earth for all who want them? What will we do for energy if the rest of the world is to be carried forward into the Age of Metals? New methods of exploration and detection are shown, including earth-imaging satellites.

results.title: Age of exploration: Spanish explorers
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Robert H. Black
results.brief_description: Depicts the discovery of America, through the eyes of the Spanish explorers. Discusses Spain’s reasons for exploration and shows the conquests of Cortez, Pizarro and others in the New World.

results.title: Age of dissent
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bernard Devlin, Guy Glover and Ian MacNeill
results.brief_description: Outspoken views of young men from Canada and Great Britain about what is wrong with the world. Provocative questions of the time are discussed by the young men, some of whom accept the values of our age, others who rebel against a society they call smug, empty and afraid. How the viewpoints of youth differ, individually, and between Canada and Britain are noted by Professor Frank Scott. Edited by Brian Keene.

results.title: Age of anxiety
results.creator_credit: John Bush, Time Inc and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “American visions”.
The subject of Hughes’ final program is American art of the late twentieth century. The United States entered the 1960’s as a rich and powerful nation, confident in its virtuous destiny, but by the end of the decade the dreams were shattered. The terrible conflict of Vietnam divided the country as it had not been divided since the Civil War a century earlier. America’s “Age of Anxiety” had begun. Hughes looks at the “tableaux” of Ed and Nancy Reddin Kienholz, works that range across the whole canon of American public imagery. He tells the story of the klutzy images of blood-stained Ku Klux Klansmen in the paintings of Philip Guston. He also meets many of the artists; Eric Fischl, Bruce Nauman and Louise Bourgeois, whose work reflects the uncertain society of the late sixties and early seventies. Hughes argues that it was Ronald Reagan’s economic policies that created the art-market boom of the 1980’s, with inflated prices and inflated egos. He confronts one of the darlings of the decade, former bond dealer Jeff Koons, in the hope of finding something meaningful in a large sculpture of a crucified kitten in a sock. For Hughes, the eighties were “a low, dishonest time for much American art.” Written and presented by Robert Hughes.

results.title: Agatha et les Lectures Illimitees
results.brief_description:
In a sprawling sea-side mansion, Agatha dialogues with her adored brother. Their impossible love, their common past come back to life as the conversation unfolds. Further viewing: ‘Duras filme’, an account of the making of ‘Agatha …’ - French Embassy Video Collection.

Credits: Director, Marguerite Duras ; writer, Marguerite Duras ; photography, Dominique Le Rigoleur ; music, Johannes Brahms.
Cast: Bulle Ogier, Yann Andrea, Margerite Duras [voice only].

results.title: Agam And
results.brief_description: Looks at Yaacov Agam, one of the world’s foremost Kinetic artists, who uses modernistic and moveable geometric designs in free moving metals, to depict his concept of life and of Judaism. Also deals with Agam’s unique concept of space and reality. Filmed in Israel, Paris and New York, his paintings and sculptures are shown. Music by Abraham Kaplan.

results.title: Against the tide
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Sumner, Interfilm and Robert Tronson
results.brief_description: Individual responsibility and teamwork are the twin themes in a film which links the continuous needs for safety precautions in the ever present dangers in life in the steel works and on the high seas.

results.title: Against the innocent
results.brief_description: This is a provocative Australian drama - its theme is counter terrorism, the use of violence and terror by the State in the name of maintaining peace and security. Prompted by the Hilton bombing, (though not referring to those events), the film follows the visit to Australia of Monica Schleyer, an expert on counter-terrorism, for a series of lectures. Schleyer soon comes under the hostile scrutiny of the media and Australian security forces, with dramatic results. Drawing on elements of political documentary and a variety of bold cinematic techniques, “Against the Innocent” vividly and lucidly examines its subject, so often reduced by the media to loaded and superficial terms like “security”, “terrorism” and “national interest”.
